person:biography.personal-details:content:
Fields of my scientific interests are conservation laws and symmetry approach for integrable nonlinear equations and systems.
Inside this research area I specialize on Darboux integrable partial differential and difference equations, their generalized Laplace invariants (which provide constructive tests of integrability and substitution existence for hyperbolic equations) and non-point transformations (differential and difference substitutions) for nonlinear equations.

keyword:keyword.keyword:content: nonlinear partial differential and difference equations

work:title.common:title: Darboux integrable discrete equations possessing an autonomous first-order integral

work:title.common:title: Non-point invertible transformations and integrability of partial difference equations

work:work-summary.work:journal-title: Symmetry, Integrability and Geometry: Methods and Applications (SIGMA)

work:title.common:title: Darboux integrable differential-difference equations admitting a first-order integral
Necessary conditions of Darboux integrability for differential-difference equations of a special kind
On non-point invertible transformations of difference and differential-difference equations

Symmetries of nonlinear hyperbolic systems of the Toda chain type
